Issues.Title: Another very likely typo in docs
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description ``` Doing this could break lazy-loading into currently running apps, especially if the lazy-loaded chunks use filenames with hashes, which change every version. ``` ...could break lazy-loading *in* currently running apps...? In general this sentence is quite obscure, and could benefit from more detail. Why there are many apps? We're discussing one app I thought? Or is it the other apps that use the shared lazy-loaded files that will get broken? There has gotta be more than one sentence here instead of a single one above... Probably not too much to not over-burden the general discussion, but something that will provide an example of a dangerous situation Thanks! ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ### What's the affected URL?** https://angular.io/guide/service-worker-communications ### Reproduction Steps** ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** ## üì∑Screenshot ## üî• Exception or Error
## üåç Your Environment ### Browser info ### Anything else relevant?

Issues.Title: Scroll position restoration does not work when route initialy does not have a scrollbar.
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? No. ### Description Consider route A which navigates to route B. Case A: - The component on Route A fetches some data, therefore initially there is no scrollbar. - The component has fetched the data and displays it in a list. There is a scrollbar present now. - The user scrolls to the bottom and selects an item which brings the user to Route B. - The user clicks on the back button and returns to Route A. - The user is now at the top of the page instead of the bottom. I'd expect the user to be at the bottom of the page where he left. Now consider case B: - The component on Route A fetches some data. In contradiction to case A, there is a scrollbar present because the content does not fit for some reason. - The component has fetched the data and displays it in a list. The scrollbar is still present but smaller now because there is more content. - The user scrolls to the bottom and selects an item which brings the user to Route B. - The user clicks on the back button and returns to Route A. - The user is now at the bottom of the page as expected. These two cases do not produce the same result. I'd expect they do. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-6stgdl For case A: - Select the heroes tab. - Notice there is no scrollbar - Wait for the heroes to load. - Scroll to the bottom and select a hero - Press the "go back" button - Wait for the heroes to load. - You are at the top of the heroes list now Case B: - Select the heroes tab. - Decrease your window size so a scrollbar is visible BEFORE the heroes are loaded. (See my screenshot) - Scroll to the bottom - Wait for the heroes to load. - Scroll to the bottom and select a hero - Press the "go back" button - Wait for the heroes to load. - You are at the bottom of the heroes list now ## üî• Exception or Error
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 




Lastest 9.0.7
**Anything else relevant?** This happens on both chrome and firefox
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Scroll position restoration does not work when route initialy does not have a scrollbar." (#36774)

Issues.Title: Navigating to named router-outlet with 'null' does not work from within named router-outlet
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? Not sure. I just stumbled upon it. ### Description The app shows two side by side instances of router-outlet. One is primary, the other one is secondary. The two links (show and hide) navigate to the secondary outlet only. "Show" navigates to OtherComponent while "hide" navigates to 'null' effectively clearing the router-outlet. Both use [routerLink] to achieve this result. This is working fine. When a link from within OtherComponent is activated (which also features a [routerLink] navigating the secondary outlet to 'null') clicking the link does not work. Furthermore, as router tracing is enabled upon clicking the link in OtherComponent, no routing information is shown and no errors are displayed either. As if the [routerLink] attribute never existed. But to make sure OtherComponent is still working, it is also included in HelloComponent's template. Clicking on a link from OtherComponent instantiated by HelloComponent **works** as expected. Conclusion: clearing a secondary outlet from a component currently active in a secondary outlet does not work. I do not see a reason why this would not work. If this is a bad thing to do, one would at least expect A) a router error in the console or B) any other error either of which would let me know that I am doing something wrong. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-spzbc3 ## üî• Exception or Error No related errors. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.1.2
Node: 12.16.2
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 9.1.2
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms

... platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server, router

Issues.Title: provide valueChangesWithSource event in AbstractControl to distinguish the event from different sources
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
@angular/forms


### Description
In` valueChanges` we have no way to know who trigger the event, by view or by `setValue` `patchValue`, but sometimes we want to handle the event differently depends on the source.

### Describe the solution you'd like
provide an observable `valueChangesWithSource` whose type is `Observable<{value: any, source: 'model'|'view'>`. when the value is changed by setValue/patchValue, `source = model`, otherwise `source=view`


### Describe alternatives you've considered
It turns out that FormControl has an attribute: `_pendingChange`, this flag will only be true when updating from view to model.
You can read this flag from the control to know if this event is trigger by user, note that this flag is undefined until the first view to model update.

example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-8-reactive-form-chmfdr?file=src/app/app.component.ts
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "provide valueChangesWithSource event in AbstractControl to distinguish the event from different sources" (#36765)

Issues.Title: Add test and fix route preload strategy loading of modules
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix
- [x] Feature

## What is the current behaviour?

This PR addresses the issues found in the issues  #22842, and pr #26557

It also replaces the PR for #26557 which has a number of issues
 * By forcing the subscription to close if a module has a lazy sub-module then the these are passed to the PreloadingStrategy class as the observable has already terminated.
 * It doesn't actually prevent the load as the fetch may overlap with the preload fetch. Ie both the pre-loader and navigation can start a load both will finish .

Issue Number:  #26557, #22842

## What is the new behaviour?

By Prevent loading a route module twice, we prevent the sending of multiple  RouteConfigLoadEnd events, and the duplicate console log as show in the stackbiz example on #26557 

We also add a new feature to SpyNgModuleFactoryLoader to enable us to emulate slow loading modules, this is required for testing.


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


## Other information / Questions

* I have a version of this based on #36654
* I need to add test to enable the and support error in loading the module. Ie if the initial load request fails, the stored load-observable need to be removed so a new one is created.
* I need suggestions for the name of the private var attached to the route to store the loading observable currently named '_loader'. It attached to the route as both the preloader and router create the own instance of the RouterConfigLoader
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add test and fix route preload strategy loading of modules" (#36760)

Issues.Title: Strange, inconsistent behavior using [ngClass] between setting `optimization` flag in build config to true or false.
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: ~8.2.7 ### Description This report is a result of attempting to upgrade to ng9/ivy from ng8/ve. When setting `optimization: true` in angular.json (which ultimately sets `ngDevMode` to `false`, which is responsible for the below inconsistency), `[ngClass]` does not function the same as it does when `optimization: false`. After investigation of the `ngClass` directive source code at runtime with `optimization: false`, I noticed that each time the `ngClass` setter was updated, `ngDoCheck` was called on the directive, which is where the `[ngClass]` directive makes necessary updates to the DOM. But if `optimization: true`, `ngDoCheck` is _not_ consistently called after the `ngClass` input changes, causing the `ngClass` instance to not apply the provided config to the element. The usage of `[ngClass]` in my case is sloppy as the attribute expression (IE: `[ngClass]=buttonStyle`) is a _getter_ that returns a _new object_ on each invocation. After updating the component implementation such that the value `buttonStyle` only changes when necessary (and is no longer a getter), the problem I'm dealing with goes away entirely. Despite this, I'm looking to understand why the original getter pattern wasn't broken in ViewEngine/ng8, but it now breaks in Ivy/ng9. I can't find information in any Ivy/ng9 upgrade guide or notes that points out why the previous `getter` approach is suddenly being handled differently. I'm concerned about other potential breaks that can occur as a result of upgrading. Ultimately I'm looking to understand why `[ngClass]` `ngDoCheck` is called consistently when `ngDevMode: true`, but is _not_ consistently called when `ngDevMode: false` when using Ivy. I'm used to angular throwing exceptions in dev mode if a feature is misused, but considering no warnings or exceptions occur in dev mode in this case, I'd expect this to work consistently between dev and prod configurations. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction (I do not yet know how to have the dev server run in prod mode on stackblitz, so in order to use this repro, you'll need to set `ngDevMode = false` manually in the console, and click "Start editing" to trigger the click handler and force cd. After forcing cd, you'll see that the `[ngClass]` input value no longer properly propagates to the element). https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-uwerky ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.1.0
Node: 12.11.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 9.1.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/9

### Description
I created a universal module for mat-dialog components. However, when using a dialog-component in a component that opens the dialog, the Angular Language Service (?) does not consider, that it is also necessary to import the corresponding module, whereas inserting in html template using the directive leads to the corresponding module import.

To show my code:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/issue-ng-universal-dialog-module

Note: The issue is actually not visible in stackblitz, because it has no Angular language service running. Webstorm should have the issue (not to show any issue when module is missing), when removing `DialogModule` from `main.ts`


### Describe the solution you'd like
Importing a component inside component.ts should consider importing the corresponding module. Or give a proper error message that the corresponding module needs to be imported. Otherwise the programmer is a litte lost finding the error.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Module not imported when importing Component from other Module in Component" (#36756)

Issues.Title: In custom date/time format add support for using local date and time sepraters
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/common


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> According to location date separators varies between
* "/" ‚Äì stroke (slash)
* "." ‚Äì dots or full stops/points (periods)
* "-" ‚Äì hyphens or dashes
* " " ‚Äì spaces
similarly time separator also changes according to location.

Currently, Angular does not provide any way to use localized date and time separators in custom formats. Due to this if a user wants to customize date/time format then he/she can't have location-specific separators.


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Angular can reserve some format pattern for specifying date separator and time separator. Like
* `D` -> date separator
* `T` -> time separator


### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> I don't; think above pattern are good enough as `d` & `D` can be confusing and someone may be using `T` in his/her custom format (as T is part of ISO format).
I also thought about
* `ds` -> date separator
* `ts` -> time separator
but, Angular is already using `s` so it can lead to confusion. Maybe we can discuss a right pattern here.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "In custom date/time format add support for using local date and time sepraters " (#36752)

Issues.Title: Confusing parameter docs with type hints in any
Issues.Body:
I'm submitting a ...
----------

```
[ ] Regression (behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[ ] Bug report 
[ ] Feature request
[x] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request
```

Current behavior ...
----------
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/acf6075ca9aa92121bb0166b2b7560aeb2c167ff/packages/forms/src/form_builder.ts#L57
and
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/acf6075ca9aa92121bb0166b2b7560aeb2c167ff/packages/forms/src/form_builder.ts#L105

The documentation about the parameter `formState` in the method `control(..)` and the parameter `controlsConfig` in the method `group(..)` (see line reference) doesn't explain very well how to set it. Additionally, the type hints has presence of `any`s and makes it harder to understand.

Expected behavior
----------
I propose the follow type hints changes to clarify the situation.

For the `formState` type hint:
`string | { value: string, disabled: boolean }`

For the `controlsConfig` type hint:
`{ [key: string]: [string | {value: string, disabled: boolean}, ...any[]] }`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Confusing parameter docs with type hints in any" (#36746)

Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [x] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
PR https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/pull/16988 has changed project generation in a way that prevents external styles and templates from being generated when using the `minimal` flag with `ng new`.


### Describe the solution you'd like
If you prefer this behavior by default, that is fine, but can you please make it so that when `inlineStyle=true` and `inlineTemplate=true` with `minimal=true`, it will actually generate the external files? Right now, those settings are ignored when used with minimal, and I don't believe they should be.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
I just regenerate the app component once the project has spun up (after removing inlineTemplate and inlineStyle from angular.json). That sets everything up the way I want, but it's still an extra step I'd like to avoid.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "inlineStyle and inlineTemplate should have precedence when used with minimal" (#17528)

Issues.Title: expose Angular-CLI VERSION as part of API
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Description Currently, I can can to the following with the Angular API, but not with the Angular-CLI API: ```typescript import { Component, VERSION as ngVersion } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'app-root', templateUrl: './app.component.html', styleUrls: ['./app.component.scss'], }) export class AppComponent { angularVersion = ngVersion.full; } ``` And the corresponding HTML: ```html

Angular version: {{ angularVersion }}

```` ### Describe the solution you'd like I would like to be able to do the following in addition to what is shown above: ```typescript import { VERSION as cliVersion } from '@angular/cli'; angularCliVersion = cliVersion.full; ``` and the corresponding HTML: ```html

Angular-CLI version: {{ angularCliVersion }}

```` ### Describe alternatives you've considered Hard-coding the Angular-CLI version number in the component.ts file.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "expose Angular-CLI VERSION as part of API" (#17527)

Issues.Title: some elements don't load to page after upgrading to angular9, (Ivy enable, prod mode only)
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core 9.x.x ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: @angular/core 8.x.x although when I disable Ivy compiler I won't see the bug in @angular/core9.x.x ### Description We have an Enterprise application was written by angular. everything was ok until we upgraded to angular9. then some components stop being shown in application. when I deep through the problem I found that angular9 Ivy component have some different mechanisms such as tree shaking, and that might cause some of my code considered as dead code. this is my assumption that Ivy engine wrongly eliminate some of our elements in the html. Or maybe sometimes angular binding don't work perfect ! In develop mode by running the `ng serve` and when we **disable Ivy engine** in production mode `ng build --prod` then every thing is Ok. When Ivy is enable in production mode I see this when I inspect element that is eliminated. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15701921/79715603-6a432e80-82e9-11ea-8033-3bc9e048aa89.png) and this is the html code of this part : ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15701921/79716244-5c8ea880-82eb-11ea-9061-d473a7ffc719.png) Note that searchResult is a list with some elements and is not empty! I see some other bugs in this page as well, I have another component in this page called **market-depth** which is defined in costume library. when I comment this component then above list works perfect!!! ## üî• Exception or Error noting is shown as exception of error in developer console. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 


 angular 9.1.2
**Anything else relevant?**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "some elements don't load to page after upgrading to angular9, (Ivy enable, prod mode only)  " (#17510)

Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

Create-react-app support   [Custom Environment Variables](https://create-react-app.dev/docs/adding-custom-environment-variables)

We need custom-environment-variables for build. for example:

```ts
Sentry.init({
  dsn: environment.SENTRY_DSN,
  environment: environment.production ? 'production' : 'development',
  release: process.env.ANGULAR_APP_COMMIT_SHA, // git commit sha1
});
```

ANGULAR_APP_COMMIT_SHA changes in every build. We can't write it in `environment.prod.ts`

### Describe the solution you'd like

Support environment variable in build.

Maybe something like process.env.ANGULAR_APP_* or other global variables

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support environment variable in build time" (#17526)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/core): workspace reader spread/rest operator usage with falsy values
Issues.Body:
Spread and Rest uses `[[GetOwnProperty]]`. Previously, properties with falsy values were being removed when using the spread operator due to an incorrect check.

https://tc39.es/proposal-object-rest-spread/#AbstractOperations-CopyDataProperties

Fixes #17021
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/core): workspace reader spread/rest operator usage with falsy values" (#17515)

Issues.Title: Server bundles are minified by default
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? No ### Description By default, the production server bundles generated by the Angular CLI are minified, making debugging much harder, despite the code comment at https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/webpack-configs/common.ts#L416 reading: > // On server, we don't want to compress anything. We still set the ngDevMode = false for it > // to remove dev code, and ngI18nClosureMode to remove Closure compiler i18n code The reason being that, when `buildOptions.platform == 'server'` is `true`, the following object is passed to the `TerserPlugin` `compress` option: ``` { ecma: terserEcma, global_defs: angularGlobalDefinitions, keep_fnames: true, } ``` However, according to the TerserPlugin's [docs](https://github.com/terser/terser#compress-options), most `compress` flags default to `true`, so this effectively causes the server code to be minified. In addition, unsetting the `scripts` optimizations in `angular.json` causes other side effects, namely `ngDevMode` no longer being explicitly set to `false`, causing the server code to run in dev mode by default. ``` "optimization": { "scripts": false, "styles": true }, ``` One workaround is to set the `NG_BUILD_DEBUG_OPTIMIZE` flag, which does turn off `compress`, but my concern is that it would get removed & renamed at some point since it's undocumented. I think `compress` should be set to `false` for server builds, as per the code comment currently reads, as working with minified code on the server is a pain. It would cause server-side bundles to jump in size, e.g. for my (fairly large) app is goes from 20 MB (with `optimization: true`) to 32 MB (with `optimization: true` but `compress: false`), but is definitely worth it IMO. I can look into drafting a PR if you guys agree with that. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 

$ npm install -g @angular/cli@latest
$ ng new ssr-minify-test
$ cd ssr-minify-test/
$ ng add @nguniversal/express-engine
$ npm run build:ssr
Manually inspect `dist/ssr-minify-test/server/main.js` -> code is minified / unreadable ## üåç Your Environment 


     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / ‚ñ≥ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): remove deprecated `evalSourceMap`, `vendorSourceMap`, `profile` and `skipAppShell` options
Issues.Body:
BREAKING CHANGE
The following deprecated devkit builder options have been removed:
- `skipAppShell:` This has no effect
- `evalSourceMap`: This done to improve performance in older versions of the CLI and is no longer needed
- `vendorSourceMap`: Use `sourceMap.vendor` instead
- `profile`: Use `NG_BUILD_PROFILING` environment variable instead

Issues.Title: bug(MatTable): Cannot have two MatSortables with the same id
Issues.Body:
When trying to dynamically remove/add columns to a `MatTable` with `MatSort` enabled, I'm getting `Cannot have two MatSortables with the same id` multiple times. Despite the errors in browser's console, the sorting feature doesn't seem to be affected.

#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-zfdrxm

Steps to reproduce:
1. Add `matSort` directive to `MatTable`
2. Add `mat-sort-header` directive to `mat-header-cell`
3. Remove and add columns dynamically
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
Dynamically add or remove columns with no errors

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
I'm getting `Cannot have two MatSortables with the same id`.

#### Environment

- Angular: 9.0.0
- CDK/Material: 9.0.0
- Browser(s): Google Chrome 81.0.4044.113
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS Mojave 10.14.6
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatTable): Cannot have two MatSortables with the same id" (#19147)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-form-field): missing styles for native select control
Issues.Body:
With the initial implementation of the MDC-based form-field we
added support for `matInput`, but it looks like the styles
for the native select were missing. This currently means that
the select might show undesired focus indiciation or that
the select is slightly inset due to the native appearance.

**Note**: Styles are a subset of the ones from the non-MDC form-field (only the needed ones). I'm unhappy about more CSS in the form-field but this one is inevitable since our form-field does not only support input/textarea, but also native select controls.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material-experimental/mdc-form-field): missing styles for native select control" (#19140)

Steps 4 and 5 have no content but the shouldn't exists. They are from embeded stepper but are damaged.

<mat-vertical-stepper>
    <mat-step>1</mat-step>

#### Expected Behavior

Issues.Title: fr([Date-range picker]): [Calendar System]
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Having an abstract layer of Calendar system in Date-range picker which does enable a possible support for [Jalali](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jalali_calendar) ,[Hijri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_calendar) and other calendar systems.

#### Use Case

I see the team is working on a Date-range picker. I'm not aware of the current design but I always see this feature missing in other libraries, It would be great that the component implement a `CalendarSystem Class` that provides calendar-related calculations. This way there would be a possibility in future to extend that class and make the Date picker component provide support for other calendar systems, and not just hard-code Gregorian.

I see a similar design currently being implemented in [NgbDatepicker](https://ng-bootstrap.github.io/#/components/datepicker/calendars).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "fr([Date-range picker]): [Calendar System]" (#19137)

Issues.Title: fix(a11y): focus monitor not working inside shadow dom
Issues.Body:
In #18667 event delegation was implemented for the `FocusMonitor` which is based around binding a single event on the `document`. The problem is that the browser won't invoke the `focus` and `blur` handlers on the `document`, if focus is moved within the same shadow root. These changes switch to delegating the events either through the closest shadow root or the `document`.

Fixes #19133.

**Note:** I spent some time trying to reproduce this in a unit test, but I wasn't able to because the way we simulate focus programmatically isn't how things behave in the browser, and we have to use programmatic focus in order to avoid flakes on the CI.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(a11y): focus monitor not working inside shadow dom" (#19135)

Issues.Title: mixinColor: Allow custom colors
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description
Add `error` as a valid `ThemePalette` 
or better yet, provide a way to create custom Palette colors. 

#### Use Case
Years ago I had the need to have a color="error" that was different than color="warn".
To accomplish this I have created scss library that creates all the css needed on all the material components to support the error color.
Here is an example of what I am talking about: https://stackblitz.com/edit/error-button-color

It works in stackblitz due to this bug: https://github.com/stackblitz/core/issues/220
With Angular9 and this setting turned on (in the tsconfig.json):
```
"angularCompilerOptions": {
    "strictTemplates": true
}
```
it returns this error:
```
Type '"error"' is not assignable to type 'ThemePalettte'
```

A third option (that I have not figured out) is can you override the ThemePalettte type definition?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mixinColor: Allow custom colors" (#19134)

Issues.Title: fix(form-field): error in newer sass versions
Issues.Body:
One internal Sass mixin was referring to the `$mat-form-field-outline-dedupe` as if it's a global, however the variable is local to the file. In previous Sass version this created a global variable silently, but in the newer ones it's a warning and it'll eventually become an error.

Also bumps our local version of Sass.

Fixes #19122.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(form-field): error in newer sass versions" (#19127)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(material-docs): Add MatIconTestingModule to documentation
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback

Add [MatIconTestingModule](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/material/icon/testing/fake-icon-registry.ts) to MatIcon documentation. Right now there is almost impossible to know this NEW feature exists, I only found it in change log.

Something like this should be enough:
> If you receive `Error: Error retrieving icon :icon_name! Unable to find icon with the name ":icon_name"` on custom icons add `MatIconTestingModule` to tests.

**Affected documentation page:** https://material.angular.io/components/icon/overview

Issues.Title: mat-contrast sass mixin provides failing accessibility colors
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
When using mat-contrast in sass from angular/material/theming the color provided doesn't pass accessibility standards for WCAG AA for normal text. Also doesn't follow the color guidelines from the material color tool

#### What is the expected behavior?
Provide color that meets accessibility standards

#### What is the current behavior?
doesn't

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://angular-ujpp3f.stackblitz.io
you can see in this example of utilizing mat-teal 600 and the given mat-contrast you can key in the values here: https://monsido.com/tools/contrast-checker and see that it fails AA standard for normal text.


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
It feels misleading to have this functionality and for it to not pass web standards.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
angular/material 7-9

#### Is there anything else we should know?
This is not limited to all colors, but each palette seems to have at least one that is wrong.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-contrast sass mixin provides failing accessibility colors" (#19123)

Issues.Title: help[matDatepickerFilter]: Getting error while updating a matdatepicker which uses matDatepickerFilter.
Issues.Body:
I am trying to disable some dates based on an array. It work fine when the datepicker has no value. when I set some value datepicker programatically, it does not recognizes the array and throws error.

### The Error
`core.js:5873 ERROR TypeError: Cannot read property 'some' of undefined
    at MatDatepickerInput.ApplyLeaveDialogComponent.blockWeekendAndLeaves [as _dateFilter] (apply-leave-dialog.component.ts:52)
    at MatDatepickerInput._filterValidator (datepicker.js:3868)
    at forms.js:1528
    at Array.map (<anonymous>)
    at _executeValidators (forms.js:1524)
    at MatDatepickerInput._validator (forms.js:1466)
    at MatDatepickerInput.validate (datepicker.js:4022)
    at forms.js:1583
    at forms.js:1528
    at Array.map (<anonymous>)`

### The Code which disables certain dates:
`blockWeekendAndLeaves = (d: Date): boolean => {
    const day = d.getDay();
    if (this.holidayList
      .some(holiday =>
        moment(holiday.holiday_date)
          .format('MM/DD/YYYY') === moment(d)
            .format('MM/DD/YYYY')) || day === 0 || day === 6) {
      return false;
    }
    return true;
  }`
### HTML
`  <mat-form-field>
            <mat-label>Select Start Date</mat-label>
            <input [matDatepickerFilter]="blockWeekendAndLeaves" matInput [matDatepicker]="leave_from_date"
                placeholder="Choose a date" formControlName="leave_from_date">
            <mat-datepicker-toggle matSuffix [for]="leave_from_date"></mat-datepicker-toggle>
            <mat-datepicker #leave_from_date></mat-datepicker>
        </mat-form-field>`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "help[matDatepickerFilter]: Getting error while updating a matdatepicker which uses matDatepickerFilter." (#19121)
